text: PREFACE
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: These tales are of the things that befell gods and men in Yarnith,
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Averon, and Zarkandhu, and in the other countries of my dreams.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: PART I.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: TIME AND THE GODS
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Once when the gods were young and only Their swarthy servant Time was
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: without age, the gods lay sleeping by a broad river upon earth. There
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: in a valley that from all the earth the gods had set apart for Their
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: repose the gods dreamed marble dreams. And with domes and pinnacles the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: dreams arose and stood up proudly between the river and the sky, all
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: shimmering white to the morning. In the city's midst the gleaming
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: marble of a thousand steps climbed to the citadel where arose four
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: pinnacles beckoning to heaven, and midmost between the pinnacles there
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: stood the dome, vast, as the gods had dreamed it. All around, terrace
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: by terrace, there went marble lawns well guarded by onyx lions and
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: carved with effigies of all the gods striding amid the symbols of the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: worlds. With a sound like tinkling bells, far off in a land of
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: shepherds hidden by some hill, the waters of many fountains turned
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: again home. Then the gods awoke and there stood Sardathrion. Not to
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: common men have the gods given to walk Sardathrion's streets, and not
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: to common eyes to see her fountains. Only to those to whom in lonely
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: passes in the night the gods have spoken, leaning through the stars, to
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: those that have heard the voices of the gods above the morning or seen
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Their faces bending above the sea, only to those hath it been given to
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: see Sardathrion, to stand where her pinnacles gathered together in the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: night fresh from the dreams of gods. For round the valley a great
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: desert lies through which no common traveller may come, but those whom
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the gods have chosen feel suddenly a great longing at heart, and
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: crossing the mountains that divide the desert from the world, set out
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: across it driven by the gods, till hidden in the desert's midst they
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: find the valley at last and look with eyes upon Sardathrion.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: In the desert beyond the valley grow a myriad thorns, and all pointing
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: towards Sardathrion. So may many that the gods have loved come to the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: marble city, but none can return, for other cities are no fitting home
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: for men whose feet have touched Sardathrion's marble streets, where
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: even the gods have not been ashamed to come in the guise of men with
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Their cloaks wrapped about their faces. Therefore no city shall ever
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: hear the songs that are sung in the marble citadel by those in whose
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: ears have rung the voices of the gods. No report shall ever come to
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: other lands of the music of the fall of Sardathrion's fountains, when
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the waters which went heavenward return again into the lake where the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: gods cool Their brows sometimes in the guise of men. None may ever hear
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the speech of the poets of that city, to whom the gods have spoken.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: It stands a city aloof. There hath been no rumour of it--I alone have
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: dreamed of it, and I may not be sure that my dreams are true.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Above the Twilight the gods were seated in the after years, ruling the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: worlds. No longer now They walked at evening in the Marble City hearing
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the fountains splash, or listening to the singing of the men they
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: loved, because it was in the after years and the work of the gods was
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: to be done.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: But often as they rested a moment from doing the work of the gods, from
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: hearing the prayers of men or sending here the Pestilence or there
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Mercy, They would speak awhile with one another of the olden years
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: saying, "Rememberest thou not Sardathrion?" and another would answer
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Ah! Sardathrion, and all Sardathrion's mist-draped marble lawns
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: whereon we walk not now."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Then the gods turned to do the work of the gods, answering the prayers
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of men or smiting them, and ever They sent Their swarthy servant Time
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: to heal or overwhelm. And Time went forth into the worlds to obey the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: commands of the gods, yet he cast furtive glances at his masters, and
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the gods distrusted Time because he had known the worlds or ever the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: gods became.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: One day when furtive Time had gone into the worlds to nimbly smite some
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: city whereof the gods were weary, the gods above the twilight speaking
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: to one another said:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Surely we are the lords of Time and gods of the worlds besides. See
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: how our city Sardathrion lifts over other cities. Others arise and
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: perish but Sardathrion standeth yet, the first and the last of cities.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rivers are lost in the sea and streams forsake the hills, but ever
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Sardathrion's fountains arise in our dream city. As was Sardathrion
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: when the gods were young, so are her streets to-day as a sign that we
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: are the gods."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Suddenly the swart figure of Time stood up before the gods, with both
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: hands dripping with blood and a red sword dangling idly from his
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: fingers, and said:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Sardathrion is gone! I have overthrown it!"
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And the gods said:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Sardathrion? Sardathrion, the marble city? Thou, thou hast overthrown
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: it? Thou, the slave of the gods?"
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And the oldest of the gods said:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Sardathrion, Sardathrion, and is Sardathrion gone?"
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And furtively Time looked him in the face and edged towards him
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: fingering with his dripping fingers the hilt of his nimble sword.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Then the gods feared with a new fear that he that had overthrown Their
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: city would one day slay the gods. And a new cry went wailing through
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the Twilight, the lament of the gods for Their dream city, crying:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Tears may not bring again Sardathrion.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "But this the gods may do who have seen, and seen with unrelenting
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: eyes, the sorrows of ten thousand worlds--thy gods may weep for thee.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Tears may not bring again Sardathrion.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Believe it not, Sardathrion, that ever thy gods sent this doom to
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: thee; he that hath overthrown thee shall overthrow thy gods.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "How oft when Night came suddenly on Morning playing in the fields of
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Twilight did we watch thy pinnacles emerging from the darkness,
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Sardathrion, Sardathrion, dream city of the gods, and thine onyx lions
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: looming limb by limb from the dusk.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "How often have we sent our child the Dawn to play with thy fountain
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: tops; how often hath Evening, loveliest of our goddesses, strayed long
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: upon thy balconies.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Let one fragment of thy marbles stand up above the dust for thine old
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: gods to caress, as a man when all else is lost treasures one lock of
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the hair of his beloved.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Sardathrion, the gods must kiss once more the place where thy streets
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: were once.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "There were wonderful marbles in thy streets, Sardathrion."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Sardathrion, Sardathrion, the gods weep for thee."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: THE COMING OF THE SEA
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Once there was no sea, and the gods went walking over the green plains
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of earth.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Upon an evening of the forgotten years the gods were seated on the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: hills, and all the little rivers of the world lay coiled at Their feet
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: asleep, when Slid, the new god, striding through the stars, came
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: suddenly upon earth lying in a corner of space. And behind Slid there
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: marched a million waves, all following Slid and tramping up the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: twilight; and Slid touched Earth in one of her great green valleys that
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: divide the south, and here he encamped for the night with all his waves
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: about him. But to the gods as They sat upon Their hilltops a new cry
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: came crying over the green spaces that lay below the hills, and the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: gods said:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "This is neither the cry of life nor yet the whisper of death. What is
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: this new cry that the gods have never commanded, yet which comes to the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: ears of the gods?"
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And the gods together shouting made the cry of the south, calling the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: south wind to them. And again the gods shouted all together making the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: cry of the north, calling the north wind to Them; and thus They
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: gathered to Them all Their winds and sent these four down into the low
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: plains to find what thing it was that called with the new cry, and to
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: drive it away from the gods.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Then all the winds harnessed up their clouds and drave forth till they
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: came to the great green valley that divides the south in twain, and
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: there found Slid with all his waves about him. Then for a space Slid
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and the four winds struggled with one another till the strength of the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: winds was gone, and they limped back to the gods, their masters, and
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: said:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "We have met this new thing that has come upon the earth and have
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: striven against its armies, but could not drive them forth; and the new
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: thing is beautiful but very angry, and is creeping towards the gods."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: But Slid advanced and led his armies up the valley, and inch by inch
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and mile by mile he conquered the lands of the gods. Then from Their
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: hills the gods sent down a great array of cliffs against hard, red
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: rocks, and bade them march against Slid. And the cliffs marched down
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: till they came and stood before Slid and leaned their heads forward and
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: frowned and stood staunch to guard the lands of the gods against the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: might of the sea, shutting Slid off from the world. Then Slid sent some
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of his smaller waves to search out what stood against him, and the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: cliffs shattered them. But Slid went back and gathered together a hoard
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of his greatest waves and hurled them against the cliffs, and the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: cliffs shattered them. And again Slid called up out of his deep a
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: mighty array of waves and sent them roaring against the guardians of
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the gods, and the red rocks frowned and smote them. And once again Slid
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: gathered his greater waves and hurled them against the cliffs; and when
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the waves were scattered like those before them the feet of the cliffs
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: were no longer standing firm, and their faces were scarred and
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: battered. Then into every cleft that stood in the rocks Slid sent his
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: hugest wave and others followed behind it, and Slid himself seized hold
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of huge rocks with his claws and tore them down and stamped them under
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: his feet. And when the tumult was over the sea had won, and over the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: broken remnants of those red cliffs the armies of Slid marched on and
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: up the long green valley.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Then the gods heard Slid exulting far away and singing songs of triumph
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: over Their battered cliffs, and ever the tramp of his armies sounded
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: nearer and nearer in the listening ears of the gods.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Then the gods called to Their downlands to save Their world from Slid,
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and the downlands gathered themselves and marched away, a great white
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: line of gleaming cliffs, and halted before Slid. Then Slid advanced no
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: more and lulled his legions, and while his waves were low he softly
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: crooned a song such as once long ago had troubled the stars and brought
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: down tears out of the twilight.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Sternly the white cliffs stood on guard to save the world of the gods,
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: but the song that once had troubled the stars went moaning on awaking
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: pent desires, till full at the feet of the gods the melody fell. Then
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the blue rivers that lay curled asleep opened their gleaming eyes,
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: uncurled themselves and shook their rushes, and, making a stir among
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the hills, crept down to find the sea. And passing across the world
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: they came at last to where the white cliffs stood, and, coming behind
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: them, split them here and there and went through their broken ranks to
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Slid at last. And the gods were angry with Their traitorous streams.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Then Slid ceased from singing the song that lures the world, and
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: gathered up his legions, and the rivers lifted up their heads with the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: waves, and all went marching on to assail the cliffs of the gods. And
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: wherever the rivers had broken the ranks of the cliffs, Slid's armies
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: went surging in and broke them up into islands and shattered the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: islands away. And the gods on Their hill-tops heard once more the voice
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of Slid exulting over Their cliffs.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Already more than half the world lay subject to Slid, and still his
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: armies advanced; and the people of Slid, the fishes and the long eels,
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: went in and out of arbours that once were dear to the gods. Then the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: gods feared for Their dominion, and to the innermost sacred recesses of
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the mountains, to the very heart of the hills, the gods trooped off
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: together and there found Tintaggon, a mountain of black marble, staring
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: far over the earth, and spake thus to him with the voices of the gods:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "O eldest born of our mountains, when first we devised the earth we
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: made thee, and thereafter fashioned fields and hollows, valleys and
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: other hills, to lie about thy feet. And now, Tintaggon, thine ancient
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: lords, the gods, are facing a new thing which overthrows the old. Go
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: therefore, thou, Tintaggon, and stand up against Slid, that the gods be
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: still the gods and the earth still green."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And hearing the voices of his sires, the elder gods, Tintaggon strode
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: down through the evening, leaving a wake of twilight broad behind him
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: as he strode: and going across the green earth came down to Ambrady at
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the valley's edge, and there met the foremost of Slid's fierce armies
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: conquering the world.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And against him Slid hurled the force of a whole bay, which lashed
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: itself high over Tintaggon's knees and streamed around his flanks and
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: then fell and was lost. Tintaggon still stood firm for the honour and
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: dominion of his lords, the elder gods. Then Slid went to Tintaggon and
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: said: "Let us now make a truce. Stand thou back from Ambrady and let me
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: pass through thy ranks that mine armies may now pass up the valley

text: THE VENGEANCE OF MEN
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Ere the Beginning the gods divided earth into waste and pasture.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Pleasant pastures They made to be green over the face of earth,
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: orchards They made in valleys and heather upon hills, but Harza They
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: doomed, predestined and foreordained to be a waste for ever.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: When the world prayed at evening to the gods and the gods answered
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: prayers They forgot the prayers of all the Tribes of Arim. Therefore
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the men of Arim were assailed with wars and driven from land to land
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and yet would not be crushed. And the men of Arim made them gods for
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: themselves, appointing men as gods until the gods of Pegana should
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: remember them again. And their leaders, Yoth and Haneth, played the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: part of gods and led their people on though every tribe assailed them.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: At last they came to Harza, where no tribes were, and at last had rest
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: from war, and Yoth and Haneth said: "The work is done, and surely now
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Pegana's gods will remember." And they built a city in Harza and tilled
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the soil, and the green came over the waste as the wind comes over the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: sea, and there were fruit and cattle in Harza and the sounds of a
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: million sheep. There they rested from their flight from all the tribes,
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and builded fables out of all their sorrows till all men smiled in
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Harza and children laughed.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Then said the gods, "Earth is no place for laughter." Thereat They
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: strode to Pegana's outer gate, to where the Pestilence lay curled
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: leapt forward howling across the sky.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: grass sat down and glared at the lights, and licked his paws and glared
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: at the lights again.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: crept into the city, and stealing into the houses one by one, peered
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: into the people's eyes, looking even through their eyelids, so that
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: when morning came men stared before them crying out that they saw the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Pestilence whom others saw not, and thereafter died, because the green
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: eyes of the Pestilence had looked into their souls. Chill and damp was
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: he, yet there came heat from his eyes that parched the souls of men.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

text: set in many books. But the Pestilence fed on the light that shines in
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the eyes of men, which never appeased his hunger; chiller and damper he
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: grew, and the heat from his eyes increased when night by night he
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: galloped through the city, going by stealth no more.

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Time and the Gods

text: And the gods listened to their prayers, but as They listened They
title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

text: up before the eyes of men.

title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: day, lying in misty hollows, but as his hunger increased he sprang up
title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Time and the Gods

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Pestilence on.
title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and sprang upward at the bats as they sailed above him, who died and
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: lay in the streets. But soon he returned and pursued the men of Harza
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: where they fled, and sat by rivers where they came to drink, away below
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the city. Then back to Harza went the people of Harza pursued by the
title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

text: the vengeance of men."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

text: of men. Know therefore that it is writ in ancient lore and found by
title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

text: WHEN THE GODS SLEPT
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: All the gods were sitting in Pegana, and Their slave, Time, lay idle at
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Pegana's gate with nothing to destroy, when They thought of worlds,
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: worlds large and round and gleaming, and little silver moons. Then (who
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: knoweth when?), as the gods raised Their hands making the sign of the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: gods, the thoughts of the gods became worlds and silver moons. And the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: worlds swam by Pegana's gate to take their places in the sky, to ride
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: at anchor for ever, each where the gods had bidden. And because they
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: were round and big and gleamed all over the sky, the gods laughed and
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: shouted and all clapped Their hands. Then upon earth the gods played
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: out the game of the gods, the game of life and death, and on the other
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: worlds They did a secret thing, playing a game that is hidden.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: At last They mocked no more at life and laughed at death no more, and
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: cried aloud in Pegana: "Will no new thing be? Must those four march for
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: ever round the world till our eyes are wearied with the treading of the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: feet of the Seasons that will not cease, while Night and Day and Life
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and Death drearily rise and fall?"
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And as a child stares at the bare walls of a narrow hut, so the gods
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: looked all listlessly upon the worlds, saying:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Will no new thing be?"
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And in Their weariness the gods said: "Ah! to be young again. Ah! to be
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: fresh once more from the brain of _Mana-Yood-Sushai_."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And They turned away Their eyes in weariness from all the gleaming
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: worlds and laid Them down upon Pegana's floor, for They said:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "It may be that the worlds shall pass and we would fain forget them."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Then the gods slept. Then did the comet break loose from his moorings
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and the eclipse roamed about the sky, and down on the earth did Death's
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: three children--Famine, Pestilence, and Drought--come out to feed. The
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: eyes of the Famine were green, and the eyes of the Drought were red,
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: but the Pestilence was blind and smote about all round him with his
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: claws among the cities.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of evil, madness, and of spite. When they crept from their galleons and
title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: gods alone upon the floor, a thing wrought of black rock and four words
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: graven upon it, whereof I might not give thee any clue, if even I
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

text: prayers which lie in the dust upon Pegana's floor, and over Them
title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Time and the Gods

text: sleep."
title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods
