title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Snyrg demanded their worship, promising increase of joys, and swearing
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: by the light of his eyes that he would send little flames to leap over
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the grass, to pursue the enemies of that city and to chase them about
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the world.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: But the people answered that in that city men worshipped Agrodaun, the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: mountain standing alone, and might not worship other gods even though
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: they came in galleons with silver sails, sailing from over the sea. But
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Snyrg answered:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Certainly Agrodaun is only a mountain, and in no manner a god."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: But the priests of Agrodaun sang answer from the shore:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "If the sacrifice of men make not Agrodaun a god, nor blood still young
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: on his rocks, nor the little fluttering prayers of ten thousand hearts,
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: nor two thousands years of worship and all the hopes of the people and
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the whole strength of our race, then are there no gods and ye be common
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: sailors, sailing from over the sea."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Then said the Yozis:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Hath Agrodaun answered prayer?" And the people heard the words that
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the Yozis said.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Then went the priests of Agrodaun away from the shore and up the steep
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: streets of the city, the people following, and over the moor beyond it
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: to the foot of Agrodaun, and then said:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Agrodaun, if thou art not our god, go back and herd with yonder common
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: hills, and put a cap of snow upon thy head and crouch far off as they
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: do beneath the sky; but if we have given thee divinity in two thousand
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: years, if our hopes are all about thee like a cloak, then stand and
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: look upon thy worshippers from over our city for ever." And the smoke
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that ascended from his feet stood still and there fell a hush over
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: great Agrodaun; and the priests went back to the sea and said to the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: three Yozis:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "New gods shall have our worship when Agrodaun grows weary of being our
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: god, or when in some night-time he shall stride away, leaving us nought
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: to gaze at that is higher than our city."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And the Yozis sailed away and cursed towards Agrodaun, but could not
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: hurt him, for he was but a mountain.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And the Yozis sailed along the coast till they came to a river running
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: to the sea, and they sailed up the river till they came to a people at
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: work, who furrowed the soil and sowed, and strove against the forest.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Then the Yozis called to the people as they worked in the fields:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Give us your worship and ye shall have many joys."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: But the people answered:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "We may not worship you."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Then answered Snyrg:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Ye also, have ye a god?"
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And the people answered:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "We worship the years to come, and we set the world in order for their
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: coming, as one layeth raiment on the road before the advent of a King.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And when those years shall come, they shall accept the worship of a
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: race they knew not, and their people shall make their sacrifice to the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: years that follow them, who, in their turn, shall minister to the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: _End_."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Then answered Snyrg:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Gods that shall recompense you not. Rather give us your prayers and
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: have our pleasures, the pleasures that we shall give you, and when your
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: gods shall come, let them be wroth--they cannot punish you."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: But the people continued to sacrifice their labour to their gods, the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: years to come, making the world a place for gods to dwell in, and the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Yozis cursed those gods and sailed away. And Ya, the Lord of malice,
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: swore that when those years should come, they should see whether it
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: were well for them to have snatched away the worship from three Yozis.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And still the Yozis sailed, for they said:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "It were better to be birds and have no air to fly in, than to be gods
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: having neither prayers nor worship."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: But where sky met with ocean, the Yozis saw land again, and thither
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: sailed; and there the Yozis saw men in strange old garments performing
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: ancient rites in a land of many temples. And the Yozis called to the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: men as they performed their ancient rites and said:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "We be three gods well versed in the needs of men, to worship whom were
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: to obtain instant joy."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: But the men said:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "We have already gods."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And Snyrg replied:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Ye, too?"
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: The men answered:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "For we worship the things that have been and all the years that were.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Divinely have they helped us, therefore we give them worship that is
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: their due."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And the Yozis answered the people:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "We be gods of the present and return good things for worship."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: But the people answered, saying from the shore:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Our gods have given us already the good things, and we return Them the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: worship that is Their due."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And the Yozis set their faces to landward, and cursed all things that
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: had been and all the years that were, and sailed in their galleons
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: away.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: A rocky shore in an inhuman land stood up against the sea. Thither the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Yozis came and found no man, but out of the dark from inland towards
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: evening came a herd of great baboons and chattered greatly when they
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: saw the ships.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Then spake Snyrg to them:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Have ye, too, a god?"
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And the baboons spat.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Then said the Yozis:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "We be seductive gods, having a particular remembrance for little
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: prayers."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: But the baboons leered fiercely at the Yozis and would have none of
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: them for gods.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: One said that prayers hindered the eating of nuts. But Snyrg leaned
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: forward and whispered, and the baboons went down upon their knees and
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: clasped their hands as men clasp, and chattered prayer and said to one
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: another that these were the gods of old, and gave the Yozis their
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: worship--for Snyrg had whispered in their ears that, if they would
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: worship the Yozis, he would make them men. And the baboons arose from
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: worshipping, smoother about the face and a little shorter in the arms,
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and went away and hid their bodies in clothing, and afterwards galloped
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: away from the rocky shore and went and herded with men. And men could
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: not discern what they were, for their bodies were bodies of men, though
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: their souls were still the souls of beasts and their worship went to
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the Yozis, spirits of ill.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And the lords of malice, hatred and madness sailed back to their island
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: in the sea and sat upon the shore as gods sit, with right hand
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: uplifted; and at evening foul prayers from the baboons gathered about
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: them and infested the rocks.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: But in Pegana the gods awoke with a start.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: THE KING THAT WAS NOT
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: The land of Runazar hath no King nor ever had one; and this is the law
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of the land of Runazar that, seeing that it hath never had a King, it
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: shall not have one for ever. Therefore in Runazar the priests hold
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: sway, who tell people that never in Runazar hath there been a King.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Althazar, King of Runazar, and lord of all lands near by, commanded for
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the closer knowledge of the gods that Their images should be carven in
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Runazar, and in all lands near by. And when Althazar's command, wafted
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: abroad by trumpets, came tinkling in the ear of all the gods, right
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: glad were They at the sound of it. Therefore men quarried marble from
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the earth, and sculptors busied themselves in Runazar to obey the edict
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of the King. But the gods stood by starlight on the hills where the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: sculptors might see Them, and draped the clouds about Them, and put
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: upon Them Their divinest air, that sculptors might do justice to
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Pegana's gods. Then the gods strode back into Pegana and the sculptors
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: hammered and wrought, and there came a day when the Master of Sculptors
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: took audience of the King, saying:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Althazar, King of Runazar, High Lord moreover of all the lands near
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: by, to whom be the gods benignant, humbly have we completed the images
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of all such gods as were in thine edict named."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Then the King commanded a great space to be cleared among the houses in
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: his city, and there the images of all the gods were borne and set
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: before the King, and there were assembled the Master of Sculptors and
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: all his men; and before each stood a soldier bearing a pile of gold
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: upon a jewelled tray, and behind each stood a soldier with a drawn
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: sword pointing against their necks, and the King looked upon the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: images. And lo! they stood as gods with the clouds all draped about
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: them, making the sign of the gods, but their bodies were those of men,
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and lo! their faces were very like the King's, and their beards were as
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the King's beard. And the King said:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "These be indeed Pegana's gods."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And the soldiers that stood before the sculptors were caused to present
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: to them the piles of gold, and the soldiers that stood behind the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: sculptors were caused to sheath their swords. And the people shouted:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "These be indeed Pegana's gods, whose faces we are permitted to see by
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the will of Althazar the King, to whom be the gods benignant." And
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: heralds were sent abroad through the cities of Runazar and of all the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: lands near by, proclaiming of the images:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "These be Pegana's gods."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: But up in Pegana the gods howled with wrath and Mung leant forward to
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: make the sign of Mung against Althazar the King. But the gods laid
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Their hands upon his shoulder saying:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Slay him not, for it is not enough that Althazar shall die, who hath
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: made the faces of the gods to be like the faces of men, but he must not
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: even have ever been."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Then said the gods:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Spake we of Althazar, a King?"
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And the gods said:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Nay, we spake not." And the gods said:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Dreamed we of one Althazar?" And the gods said:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Nay, we dreamed not."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: But in the royal palace of Runazar, Althazar, passing suddenly out of
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the remembrance of the gods, became no longer a thing that was or had
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: ever been.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And by the throne of Althazar lay a robe, and near it lay a crown, and
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the priests of the gods entered his palace and made it a temple of the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: gods. And the people coming to worship said:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Whose was this robe and to what purpose is this crown?"
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And the priests answered:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "The gods have cast away the fragment of a garment and lo! from the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: fingers of the gods hath slipped one little ring."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And the people said to the priests:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Seeing that Runazar hath never had a King, therefore be ye our rulers,
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and make ye our laws in the sight of Pegana's gods."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: THE CAVE OF KAI
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: The pomp of crowning was ended, the rejoicings had died away, and
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Khanazar, the new King, sat in the seat of the Kings of Averon to do
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: his work upon the destinies of men. His uncle, Khanazar the Lone, had
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: died, and he had come from a far castle to the south, with a great
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: procession, to Ilaun, the citadel of Averon; and there they had crowned
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: him King of Averon and of the mountains, and Lord, if there be aught
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: beyond those mountains, of all such lands as are. But now the pomp of
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the crowning was gone away and Khanazar sat afar off from his home, a
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: very mighty King.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Then the King grew weary of the destinies of Averon and weary of the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: making of commands. So Khanazar sent heralds through all cities saying:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Hear! The will of the King! Hear! The will of the King of Averon and
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of the mountains and Lord, if there be aught beyond those mountains, of
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: all such lands as are. Let there come together to Ilaun all such as
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: have an art in secret matters. Hear!"
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And there gathered together to Ilaun the wise men of all the degrees of
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: magic, even to the seventh, who had made spells before Khanazar the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Lone; and they came before the new King in his palace placing their
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: hands upon his feet. Then said the King to the magicians:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "I have a need."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And they answered:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "The earth touches the feet of the King in token of submission."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: But the King answered:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "My need is not of the earth; but I would find certain of the hours
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that have been, and sundry days that were."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And all the wise folks were silent, till there spake out mournfully the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: wisest of them all, who made spells in the seventh degree, saying:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "The days that were, and the hours, have winged their way to Mount
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Agdora's summit, and there, dipping, have passed away from sight, not
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: ever to return, for haply they have not heard the King's command."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Of these wise folks are many things chronicled. Moreover, it is set in
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: writing of the scribes how they had audience of King Khanazar and of
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the words they spake, but of their further deeds there is no legend.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: But it is told how the King sent men to run and pass through all the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: cities till they should find one that was wiser even than the magicians
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that had made spells before Khanazar the Lone. Far up the mountains
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that limit Averon they found Syrahn, the prophet, among the goats, who
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: was of none of the degrees of magic, and who had cast no spells before
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the former King. Him they brought to Khanazar, and the King said unto
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: him:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "I have a need."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And Syrahn answered:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Thou art a man."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And the King said:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Where lie the days that were and certain hours?"
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And Syrahn answered:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "These things lie in a cave afar from here, and over the cave stands
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: sentinel one Kai, and this cave Kai hath guarded from the gods and men
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: since ever the Beginning was made. It may be that he shall let Khanazar
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: pass by."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Then the King gathered elephants and camels that carried burdens of
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: gold, and trusty servants that carried precious gems, and gathered an
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: army to go before him and an army to follow behind, and sent out
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: horsemen to warn the dwellers of the plains that the King of Averon was
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: afoot.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And he bade Syrahn to lead to that place where the days of old lie hid
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and all forgotten hours.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Across the plain and up Mount Agdora, and dipping beyond its summit
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: went Khanazar the King, and his two armies who followed Syrahn. Eight
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: times the purple tent with golden border had been pitched for the King
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of Averon, and eight times it had been struck ere the King and the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: King's armies came to a dark cave in a valley dark, where Kai stood
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: guard over the days that were. And the face of Kai was as a warrior
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that vanquisheth cities and burdeneth himself not with captives, and
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: his form was as the forms of gods, but his eyes were the eyes of
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: beasts; before whom came the King of Averon with elephants and camels
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: bearing burdens of gold, and trusty servants carrying precious gems.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Then said the King:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Yonder behold my gifts. Give back to me my yesterday with its waving
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: banners, my yesterday with its music and blue sky and all its cheering
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: crowds that made me King, the yesterday that sailed with gleaming wings
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: over my Averon."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And Kai answered, pointing to his cave:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Thither, dishonoured and forgot, thy yesterday slunk away. And who
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: amid the dusty heap of the forgotten days shall grovel to find thy
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: yesterday?"
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Then answered the King of Averon and of the mountains and Lord, if
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: there be aught beyond them, of all such lands as are:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "I will go down on my knees in yon dark cave and search with my hands
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: amid the dust, if so I may find my yesterday again and certain hours
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that are gone."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And the King pointed to his piles of gold that stood where elephants
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: were met together, and beyond them to the scornful camels. And Kai
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: answered:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "The gods have offered me the gleaming worlds and all as far as the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rim, and whatever lies beyond it as far as the gods may see--and thou
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: comest to me with elephants and camels."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Then said the King:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Across the orchards of my home there hath passed one hour whereof thou
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: knowest well, and I pray to thee, who wilt take no gifts borne upon
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: elephants or camels, to give me of thy mercy one second back, one grain
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of dust that clings to that hour in the heap that lies within thy
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: cave."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And, at the word mercy, Kai laughed. And the King turned his armies to
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the east. Therefore the armies returned to Averon and the heralds
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: before them cried:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Here cometh Khanazar, King of Averon and of the mountains and Lord, if
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: there be aught beyond those mountains, of all such lands as are."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And the King said to them:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Say rather that here comes one greatly wearied who, having
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: accomplished nought, returneth from a quest forlorn."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: So the King came again to Averon.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: But it is told how there came into Ilaun one evening as the sun was
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: setting a harper with a golden harp desiring audience of the King.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And it is told how men led him to Khanazar, who sat frowning alone upon
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: his throne, to whom said the harper:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "I have a golden harp; and to its strings have clung like dust some
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: seconds out of the forgotten hours and little happenings of the days
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that were."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And Khanazar looked up and the harper touched the strings, and the old
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: forgotten things were stirring again, and there arose a sound of songs
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that had passed away and long since voices. Then when the harper saw
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that Khanazar looked not angrily upon him his fingers tramped over the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: chords as the gods tramp down the sky, and out of the golden harp arose
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: a haze of memories; and the King leaning forward and staring before him
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: saw in the haze no more his palace walls, but saw a valley with a
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: stream that wandered through it, and woods upon either hill, and an old
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: castle standing lonely to the south. And the harper, seeing a strange
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: look upon the face of Khanazar, said:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Is the King pleased who lords it over Averon and the mountains, and,
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: if there be aught beyond them, over all such lands as are?"
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And the King said:--
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Seeing that I am a child again in a valley to the south, how may I say
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: what may be the will of the great King?"
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: When the stars shone high over Ilaun and still the King sat staring
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: straight before him, all the courtiers drew away from the great palace,
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: save one that stayed and kept one taper burning, and with them went the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: harper.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And when the dawn came up through silent archways into the marble
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: palace, making the taper pale, the King still stared before him, and
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: still he sat there when the stars shone again clearly and high above
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Ilaun.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: But on the second morning the King arose and sent for the harper and
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: said to him:--
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "I am King again, and thou that hast a skill to stay the hours and mayest
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: may bring again to men their forgotten days, thou shalt stand sentinel
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: over my great to-morrow; and when I go forth to conquer Ziman-ho and
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: make my armies mighty thou shalt stand between that morrow and the cave
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of Kai, and haply some deed of mine and the battling of my armies shall
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: cling to thy golden harp and not go down dishonoured into the cave. For
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: my to-morrow, who with such resounding stride goes trampling through my
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: dreams, is far too kingly to herd with forgotten days in the dust of
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: things that were. But on some future day, when Kings are dead and all
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: their deeds forgotten, some harper of that time shall come and from those
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: golden strings awake those deeds that echo in my dreams, till my to-morrow
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: shall stride forth among the lesser days and tell the years that Khanazar
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: was a King."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And answered the harper:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "I will stand sentinel over thy great to-morrow, and when thou goest
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: forth to conquer Ziman-ho and make thine armies mighty I will stand
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: between thy morrow and the cave of Kai, till thy deeds and the battling
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of thine armies shall cling to my golden harp and not go down
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: dishonoured into the cave. So that when Kings are dead and all their
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: deeds forgotten the harpers of the future time shall awake from these
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: golden chords those deeds of thine. This will I do."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Men of these days, that be skilled upon the harp, tell still of
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Khanazar, how that he was King of Averon and of the mountains, and
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: claimed lordship of certain lands beyond, and how he went with armies
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: against Ziman-ho and fought great battles, and in the last gained
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: victory and was slain. But Kai, as he waited with his claws to gather
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: in the last days of Khanazar that they might loom enormous in his cave,
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: still found them not, and only gathered in some meaner deeds and the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: days and hours of lesser men, and was vexed by the shadow of a harper
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that stood between him and the world.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: THE SORROW OF SEARCH
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: It is told also of King Khanazar how he bowed very low unto the gods of
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Old. None bowed so low unto the gods of Old as did King Khanazar.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: One day the King returning from the worship of the gods of Old and from
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: bowing before them in the temple of the gods commanded their prophets
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: to appear before him, saying:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "I would know somewhat concerning the gods."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Then came the prophets before King Khanazar, burdened with many books,
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: to whom the King said:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "It is not in books."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Thereat the prophets departed, bearing away with them a thousand
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: methods well devised in books whereby men may gain wisdom of the gods.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: One alone remained, a master prophet, who had forgotten books, to whom
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the King said:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "The gods of Old are mighty."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And answered the master prophet:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Very mighty are the gods of Old."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Then said the King:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "There are no gods but the gods of Old."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And answered the prophet:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "There are none other."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And they two being alone within the palace the King said:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Tell me aught concerning gods or men if aught of the truth be known."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Then said the master prophet:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Far and white and straight lieth the road to Knowing, and down it in
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the heat and dust go all wise people of the earth, but in the fields
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: before they come to it the very wise lie down or pluck the flowers. By
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the side of the road to Knowing--O King, it is hard and hot--stand many
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: temples, and in the doorway of every temple stand many priests, and
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: they cry to the travellers that weary of the road, crying to them:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "This is the End."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And in the temples are the sounds of music, and from each roof arises
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the savour of pleasant burning; and all that look at a cool temple,
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: whichever temple they look at, or hear the hidden music, turn in to see
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: whether it be indeed the End. And such as find that their temple is not
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: indeed the End set forth again upon the dusty road, stopping at each
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: temple as they pass for fear they miss the End, or striving onwards on
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the road, and see nothing in the dust, till they can walk no longer and
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: are taken worn and weary of their journey into some other temple by a
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: kindly priest who shall tell them that this also is the End. Neither on
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that road may a man gain any guiding from his fellows, for only one
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: thing that they say is surely true, when they say:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Friend, we can see nothing for the dust."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And of the dust that hides the way much has been there since ever that
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: road began, and some is stirred up by the feet of all that travel upon
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: it, and more arises from the temple doors.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And, O King, it were better for thee, travelling upon that road, to
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: rest when thou hearest one calling: "This is the End," with the sounds
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of music behind him. And if in the dust and darkness thou pass by Lo
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and Mush and the pleasant temple of Kynash, or Sheenath with his opal
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: smile, or Sho with his eyes of agate, yet Shilo and Mynarthitep, Gazo
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and Amurund and Slig are still before thee and the priests of their
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: temples will not forget to call thee.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And, O King, it is told that only one discerned the end and passed by
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: three thousand temples, and the priests of the last were like the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: priests of the first, and all said that their temple was at the end of
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the road, and the dark of the dust lay over them all, and all were very
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: pleasant and only the road was weary. And in some were many gods, and
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: in a few only one, and in some the shrine was empty, and all had many
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: priests, and in all the travellers were happy as they rested. And into
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: some his fellow travellers tried to force him, and when he said:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "I will travel further," many said:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "This man lies, for the road ends here."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And he that travelled to the End hath told that when the thunder was
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: heard upon the road there arose the sound of the voices of all the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: priests as far as he could hear, crying:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Hearken to Shilo"--"Hear Mush"--"Lo! Kynash"--"The voice of
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Sho"--"Mynarthitep is angry"--"Hear the word of Slig!"
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And far away along the road one cried to the traveller that Sheenath
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: stirred in his sleep.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: O King this is very doleful. It is told that that traveller came at
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: last to the utter End and there was a mighty gulf, and in the darkness
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: at the bottom of the gulf one small god crept, no bigger than a hare,
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: whose voice came crying in the cold:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "I know not."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And beyond the gulf was nought, only the small god crying.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And he that travelled to the End fled backwards for a great distance
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: till he came to temples again, and entering one where a priest cried:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "This is the End," lay down and rested on a couch. There Yush sat
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: silent, carved with an emerald tongue and two great eyes of sapphire,
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and there many rested and were happy. And an old priest, coming from
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: comforting a child, came over to that traveller who had seen the End
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and said to him:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "This is Yush and this is the End of wisdom."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And the traveller answered:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Yush is very peaceful and this indeed the End."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "O King, wouldst thou hear more?"
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And the King said:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "I would hear all."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And the master prophet answered:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "There was also another prophet and his name was Shaun, who had such
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: reverence for the gods of Old that he became able to discern their
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: forms by starlight as they strode, unseen by others, among men. Each
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: night did Shaun discern the forms of the gods and every day he taught
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: concerning them, till men in Averon knew how the gods appeared all grey
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: against the mountains, and how Rhoog was higher than Mount Scagadon,
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and how Skun was smaller, and how Asgool leaned forward as he strode,
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and how Trodath peered about him with small eyes. But one night as
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Shaun watched the gods of Old by starlight, he faintly discerned some
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: other gods that sat far up the slopes of the mountains in the stillness
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: behind the gods of Old. And the next day he hurled his robe away that
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: he wore as Averon's prophet and said to his people:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "There be gods greater than the gods of Old, three gods seen faintly on
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the hills by starlight looking on Averon."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And Shaun set out and travelled many days and many people followed him.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And every night he saw more clearly the shapes of the three new gods
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: who sat silent when the gods of Old were striding among men. On the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: higher slopes of the mountain Shaun stopped with all his people, and
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: there they built a city and worshipped the gods, whom only Shaun could
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: see, seated above them on the mountain. And Shaun taught how the gods
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: were like grey streaks of light seen before dawn, and how the god on
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the right pointed upward toward the sky, and how the god on the left
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: pointed downward toward the ground, but the god in the middle slept.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And in the city Shaun's followers built three temples. The one on the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: right was a temple for the young, and the one on the left a temple for
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the old, and the third was a temple for the old, and the third was a
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: temple with doors closed and barred--therein none ever entered. One
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: night as Shaun watched before the three gods sitting like pale light
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: against the mountain, he saw on the mountain's summit two gods that
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: spake together and pointed, mocking the gods of the hill, only he heard
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: no sound. The next day Shaun set out and a few followed him to climb to
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the mountain's summit in the cold, to find the gods who were so great
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that they mocked at the silent three. And near the two gods they halted
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and built for themselves huts. Also they built a temple wherein the Two
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: were carved by the hand of Shaun with their heads turned towards each
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: other, with mockery on Their faces and Their fingers pointing, and
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: beneath Them were carved the three gods of the hill as actors making
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: sport. None remembered now Asgool, Trodath, Skun, and Rhoog, the gods
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of Old.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: For many years Shaun and his few followers lived in their huts upon the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: mountain's summit worshipping gods that mocked, and every night Shaun
title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

text: THE MEN OF YARNITH
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: hand. Yarni Zai, they say, has the form of a man but is greater and is
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Time and the Gods

text: around Yarni Zai.

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: them.
title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

text: FOR THE HONOUR OF THE GODS
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

text: sea and earth and the gardens of earth. And Yahn said: "I will loan you
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: each a Life, and you may do your work with it upon the Scheme of
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Time and the Gods

text: gardens, only for these things you shall polish these Lives with
title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And thereto the shadows consented, that they might have gleaming Lives
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and have shadows for their servants, and this thing became the Law. But
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the shadows, each with his Life, departed and came to Zonu and to other
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: lands, and there with experience they polished the Lives of Yahn, and
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: cut them with human griefs until they gleamed anew. And ever they found
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: new scenes to gleam within these Lives, and cities and sails and men
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: shone in them where there had been before only green fields and sea,
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and ever Yahn the usurer cried out to remind them of their bargain.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: When men added to their Lives scenes that were pleasant to Yahn, then
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: was Yahn silent, but when they added scenes that pleased not the eyes
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of Yahn, then did he take a toll of sorrow from them because it was the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Law.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: But men forgot the usurer, and there arose some claiming to be wise in
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the Law, who said that after their labour, which they wrought upon
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: their Lives, was done, those Lives should be theirs to possess; so men
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: took comfort from their toil and labour and the grinding and cutting of
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: their griefs. But as their Lives began to shine with experience of many
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: things, the thumb and forefinger of Yahn would suddenly close upon a
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Life, and the man became a shadow. But away beyond the Rim the shadows
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: say:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "We have greatly laboured for Yahn, and have gathered griefs in the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: world, and caused his Lives to shine, and Yahn doeth nought for us. Far
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: better had we stayed where no cares are, floating beyond the Rim."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And there the shadows fear lest ever again they be lured by specious
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: promises to suffer usury at the hands of Yahn, who is overskilled in
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Law. Only Yahn sits and smiles, watching his hoard increase in
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: preciousness, and hath no pity for the poor shadows whom he hath lured
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: from their quiet to toil in the form of men.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And ever Yahn lures more shadows and sends them to brighten his Lives,
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: sending the old Lives out again to make them brighter still; and
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: sometimes he gives to a shadow a Life that was once a king's and
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: sendeth him with it down to the earth to play the part of a beggar, or
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: sometimes he sendeth a beggar's Life to play the part of a king. What
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: careth Yahn?
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: The men of Zonu have been promised by those that claim to be wise in
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the Law that their Lives which they have toiled at shall be theirs to
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: possess for ever, yet the men of Zonu fear that Yahn is greater and
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: overskilled in the Law. Moreover it hath been said that Time will bring
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the hour when the wealth of Yahn shall be such as his dreams have
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: lusted for. Then shall Yahn leave the earth at rest and trouble the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: shadows no more, but sit and gloat with his unseemly face over his
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: hoard of Lives, for his soul is a usurer's soul. But others say, and
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: they swear that this is true, that there are gods of Old, who be far
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: greater than Yahn, who made the Law wherein Yahn is overskilled, and
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: who will one day drive a bargain with him that shall be too hard for
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Yahn. Then Yahn shall wander away, a mean forgotten god, and perchance
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: in some forsaken land shall haggle with the rain for a drop of water to
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: drink, for his soul is a usurer's soul. And the Lives--who knoweth the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: gods of Old or what Their will shall be?

text: MLIDEEN
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And the gods sat and smiled.

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

text: THE SECRET OF THE GODS
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Zyni Moe, the small snake, saw the cool river gleaming before him afar
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: off and set out over the burning sand to reach it.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Uldoon, the prophet, came out of the desert and followed up the bank of
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the river towards his old home. Thirty years since Uldoon had left the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: city, where he was born, to live his life in a silent place where he
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: might search for the secret of the gods. The name of his home was the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: City by the River, and in that city many prophets taught concerning
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: many gods, and men made many secrets for themselves, but all the while
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: none knew the Secret of the gods. Nor might any seek to find it, for if
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: any sought men said of him:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "This man sins, for he giveth no worship to the gods that speak to our
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: prophets by starlight when none heareth."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And Uldoon perceived that the mind of a man is as a garden, and that
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: his thoughts are as the flowers, and the prophets of a man's city are
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: as many gardeners who weed and trim, and who have made in the garden
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: paths both smooth and straight, and only along these paths is a man's
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: soul permitted to go lest the gardeners say, "This soul transgresseth."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And from the paths the gardeners weed out every flower that grows, and
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: in the garden they cut off all flowers that grow tall, saying:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "It is customary," and "it is written," and "this hath ever been," or
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "that hath not been before."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Therefore Uldoon saw that not in that city might he discover the Secret
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of the gods. And Uldoon said to the people:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "When the worlds began, the Secret of the gods lay written clear over
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the whole earth, but the feet of many prophets have trampled it out.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Your prophets are all true men, but I go into the desert to find a
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: truth which is truer than your prophets." Therefore Uldoon went into
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the desert and in storm and still he sought for many years. When the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: thunder roared over the mountains that limited the desert he sought the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Secret in the thunder, but the gods spake not by the thunder. When the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: voices of the beasts disturbed the stillness under the stars he sought
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the secret there, but the gods spake not by the beasts.
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Uldoon grew old and all the voices of the desert had spoken to Uldoon,
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: but not the gods, when one night he heard Them whispering beyond the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: hills. And the gods whispered one to another, and turning Their faces
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: earthward They all wept. And Uldoon though he saw not the gods yet saw
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Their shadows turn as They went back to a great hollow in the hills;
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and there, all standing in the valley's mouth, They said:
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and yesterday for the last time thy name was spoken upon earth." And
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: turning earthward they all wept again. And the gods tore white clouds
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: out of the sky and draped them about the body of Morning Zai and bore
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

text: THE SOUTH WIND
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Two players sat down to play a game together to while eternity away,
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and they chose the gods as pieces wherewith to play their game, and for
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: their board of playing they chose the sky from rim to rim, whereon lay
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: a little dust; and every speck of dust was a world upon the board of
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: playing. And the players were robed and their faces veiled, and the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: robes and veils were alike, and their names were Fate and Chance. And
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: as they played their game and moved the gods hither and thither about
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the board, the dust arose, and shone in the light from the players'
title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

text: stir the dust."

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: heads, stretched out to make his move. Then Ord, the prophet, knew. Had
title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

title: Time and the Gods

author: Dunsany, Lord

text: known," and "I have known."
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: But all things sleep when the South Wind speaks to them and none heed
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: his cry that he hath known, but are rather content to sleep. But still
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the South Wind, knowing that there is something that he hath forgot,
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: goes on crying, "I have known," seeking to urge men to arise and to
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: discover it. But none heed the sorrows of the South Wind even when he
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: driveth his tears out of the South, so that though the South Wind cries
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: on and on and never findeth rest none heed that there is aught that may
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: be known, and the Secret of the gods is safe. But the business of the
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: South Wind is with the North, and it is said that the time will one day
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: come when he shall overcome the bergs and sink the seas of ice and come
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: where the Secret of the gods is graven upon the pole. And the game of
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Fate and Chance shall suddenly cease and He that loses shall cease to
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: be or ever to have been, and from the board of playing Fate or Chance
title: Time and the Gods
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: (who knoweth which shall win?) shall sweep the gods away.
